radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder wall is markedly edematous. There are multiple gallstones within the gallbladder. No biliary duct dilatation. The common bile duct measures 5 mm; no stones within the common duct. No focal liver lesions seen. There is a focal area of low-signal intensity seen in the fissure for the falciform ligament consistent with perfusional change. The main portal vein and hepatic veins are patent. The spleen, both kidneys and both adrenal glands are unremarkable in appearance. The pancreas is unremarkable. No free fluid. No upper abdominal lymphadenopathy. The visualized bone marrow is unremarkable.
